Se dedica a la siembra de  papa, cebolla y zanahoria en una parcela que tiene a unos metros de su vivienda, ya que es donde se pueden cosechar mejores verduras y obtener buenos precios al momento de su  venta en el mercado. 
Eligio este  trabajo porque desde niño ayudaba a su padre en el campo y ahora lleva 15 años teniendo su propio cultivo,  la cual esta satisfecho porque obtiene ganancias buenas  para poder mantener a su familia.
Por la temporada de medio año es donde el precio de algunas verduras mejoran,  por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00  para comprar fertilizante orgánico y semillas de cebolla para poder cultivar.
Su sueño es comprar un terreno para poder construir su vivienda y así mejorar su forma de vida.
texts.en:
Ronaldo is a single man of 27. He lives with his parents and siblings in the settlement of San Isidro, Sacsiguán canton, Sololá, Sololá. He is a hard-working man ready to get ahead with his family with dedicated work in agriculture. He plants potatoes, onions and carrots on a plot that he has a few meters from his home, since that is where the best vegetables can be grown that get a good price when sold at the market. He chose this work because he's helped his father in the field since he was a boy. Now he's had his own crop for 15 years. This pleases him because he earns a good profit to be able to support his family.

Around mid-year is when the price of some vegetables improves, which is why he is requesting a loan of 6,000.00 quetzales to buy organic fertilizer and onion seeds to grow.

His dream is to buy a piece of land to build his home on and thereby improve his way of life.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and onion seeds.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 43 years old and is married. She has eight children; four children are in school.

Analie is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analie has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Analie has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer and to pay for sugarcane laborers. In the future, Analie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and pay for sugarcane laborers

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 73 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marina is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Marina has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Petrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Petrina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bamboo business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing.  Petrina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell for her buy-and-sell bamboo business.

Petrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aracely, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, una zona marginal de Managua, está casada su esposo trabaja como obrero, ambos se apoyan y buscan como salir adelante junto a sus hijos, Aracely continua con su pequeño negocio de pulpería que hasta la fecha es su único medio de ingresos. E l crédito lo solicita para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, necesita invertir en poner verjas y puertas  al porche de su vivienda, ya que está muy expuesta, con esta inversión podrá brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Aracely lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino, which is on the outskirts of Managua.  Her husband works as a laborer.  They support each other and are working together to find the best path forward for themselves and their children.

She is continuing to run her small grocery store, which at the moment is her only source of income.  She is seeking this loan in order to make improvements to her home.  She needs to invest in iron grating and a gate for her porch, since it is currently very exposed to the outside.  Through this investment she will be able to provide greater security for her family.

loans.use: to guy iron grating and a prefabricated gate for her porch.

loans.name: Lourdes Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes, de 33 años vive con su hija en su casa de habitación en un barrio San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 09  años a la venta de arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, carne, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis, refrescos en todas sus presentaciones.
Doña Lourdes vende de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y amigos,  su negocio está ubicado en su casa.
Doña Lourdes está solicitando el préstamo para compra de  mas productos para la canasta básica como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, queso, pan, leche, galletas, churros, refrescos, café, salsas, pastas, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar mas el volumen de sus ventas y espera que le genere ingresos y con esto poder seguir apoyando en los estudios a  su hija.
Doña Lourdes su sueño es que su hija termina sus estudios y ampliando su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio  del 2013.
texts.en: Lourdes is thirty-three years old and lives with her daughter. Their home is in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo, which is in the southern part of Honduras. For the past nine years, she has had a business selling rice, beans, butter, eggs, oil, chicken, meat, sausages, tomato sauce, spaghetti, and all types of soft drinks. She works every day of the week, and her customers are all friends and neighbors. Her business is located in her home. She is seeking this loan in order to purchase more grocery products, such as rice, sugar, beans, cheese, bread, milk, cookies, churros, soft drinks, coffee, sauces, pastas and other items for her business. With this funding she intends to increase her volume of sales. She hopes that this will generate enough income to continue covering her daughter's schooling costs. Her goals are to expand her business and to see that her daughter completes her studies. San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, bread, milk, cookies, churros, soft drinks, coffee, sauces, pastas and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 37 years old and is married with seven children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to help her husband meet the family's needs. Jessica has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Jessica requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like a fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc. Jessica has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jessica would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as a fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 28 years old and married, with four children.

Melody works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like sardines, coffee, milk, soap, and noodles.

Melody has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from prepaid mobile load.

Melody aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like sardines, coffee, milk, soap, and noodles.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as noodles, eggs, spices, shampoo, etc. for her general store business. Glenda has been in this business for three years. Glenda earns additional income from rice retailing and farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her general store as well as her businesses farming vegetables and selling rice. Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, spices, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

Juanita requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her abaca weaving business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Juanita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en:
Lavella is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business making broomsticks in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials for her broomstick-making business.

Lavella has been in this business for 15 years. Lavella earns additional income from pig-fattening. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lavella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her broomstick business.

loans.name: Kulnara

texts.ru: Кульнара, 57 лет, замужем, 2 сына. Более 30 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, мастер в своем деле по хозяйству. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья. Образование у Кульнары средне-специальное. Начала бизнес с 30000 сом(KGS), ежемесячная прибыль 9000 сом(KGS). В хозяйстве имеет 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец и 1 лошадь. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Кульнара обратилась к нам в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку 2 бычков для дальнейшего разведения и перепродажи. На доходы от кредита Кульнара хочет расширить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Kulnara is 57 years old, married and has two sons.  For more than 30 years, she has worked with livestock and in farming--she's a master.  Her whole family helps her with her work.  Kulnara graduated high school . She started her business with 30,000 KGS and her monthly profits are around 9,000 KGS.  She now has two dairy cows, 20 sheep and one horse.  With the goal of further increasing the number of animals in her care, Kulnara has turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy two bulls to breed and resell.  She wants to use the income provided by the loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 36 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y su hijo. Karina tiene una pequeño puesto de condimentos “especerías”, ahí ella prepara diferentes combinaciones de condimentos para poder venderlos a sus clientes que siempre van a comprar en su puesto. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 13 años y siempre trabajó sola como hasta ahora. Todo lo que realiza en su puesto es muy bueno para ella, ya que durante su tiempo trabajando ahí supo ganarse un buen número de clientes que siempre van a comprarle y eso le genera buenas ganancias, espera seguir trabajando mucho para poder hacer crecer su negocio y con lo mismo su economía. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes, condimentos y especias para aumentar su variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes como comino, pimienta, ajos, etc.
texts.en: Karina is thirty-six and lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She has a small stand from which she sells spices and condiments. She prepares different combinations of condiments to sell to her customers, who always come to buy from her. She has been doing this work for thirteen years and has always worked on her own. Everything that she does in her business is very good for her, since during her time working there she has learned how to gain a good number of loyal customers, which in turn leads to good profits. She hopes to continue working hard so that she can grow her business and improve her financial situation. She is currently seeking a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles. She wishes to thank everyone who is making it possible for her to obtain this loan, which she needs in order to meet her business objectives. With these funds she will purchase ingredients, condiments and spices, such as pepper, cumin and garlic. This will enable to increase the variety of products that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more spices, such as pepper and cumin, for her business.

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
Ancheta is 44 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ancheta is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ancheta has been pig fattening for ten years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es: Lupita tiene 43 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Lupita vende diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene para ofrecer ya sean pantalones, polos, camisas, etc. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 8 años y lo hace sola ya que considera que no necesita otra persona para ejercer esta función. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener tiempo para poder trabajar en una institución del estado, además la venta de ropa le significa una entrada adicional para su economía y así puede dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, desea seguir trabajando y mas adelante poder tener una boutique o un local comercial en donde ofrecer sus productos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Con el monto solicitado comprará prendas de vestir conformada por blusas, camisas, y polos de hombres y mujeres para su negocio.
texts.en: Lupita is 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her two children in a house that she owns. Lupita sells various garments that she has to offer, such as trousers, shirts, polo shirts, etc. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and she works alone, since she believes she doesn't need another person for the job. She greatly enjoys what she does because it allows her to have the time to work for a public institution. Aside from selling clothing, this means an additional source of income for her, and thus she's able to improve her family's living conditions. She wishes to keep on working and later on open a boutique or a store where she can sell her merchandise. On this occasion she'll request 1,000 soles. She gives thanks for the opportunity she's been given to get the loan she needs in order to continue achieving her goals. With the requested amount she'll purchase garments such as blouses, shirts, and polo shirts for men and women for her business.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts and polo shirts for selling in her business.

loans.name: Leyter

texts.es: Leyter tiene 18 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres juntos a ellos y sus hermanos. Leyter se dedica al transporte vehicular de la ciudad en la que vive. Tiene un mototaxi que le compró su padre hace 1 año y desde entonces trabaja tratando de dar siempre lo mejor de sí para agradar a sus pasajeros. Desde que se inició en esta actividad a trabajado siempre solo, siempre está atento a nuevas oportunidades, es por eso que ahora quiere comprarse otro mototaxi con su propio esfuerzo y seguir desarrollando su labor. Espera hacerlo en corto tiempo y continuar esforzándose en todo lo que hace por el bien de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y en tapizar su mototaxi actual.
texts.en: Leyter is 18 years old and single. He lives in his parents' house with his parents and siblings. Leyter provides transportation services in the town where he lives. He owns a motorcycle taxi which his father bought for him a year ago, and ever since then he's been working and trying to always do his best in order to please his passengers. Ever since he started this business he has always worked alone. He's always looking for new opportunities, and that's why he now wishes to buy another motorcycle taxi through his own efforts and continue doing his work. He hopes to do that soon and to keep on working hard on all his endeavors for his family's sake. On this occasion he'll request 500 soles. He gives thanks to all the people who give him the opportunity to get the loan he needs to continue working. On the other hand, he pledges to comply with his repayments. He will use the requested amount to purchase tires and upholster his current motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to purchase tires and upholster his motorcycle taxi for his transportation business.

loans.name: Dúo Balles Del Sargento Group

texts.es:
DUO BALLES DEL SARGENTO

DUO CONFORMADO POR DOÑA HERMINIA DE 62 AÑOS DE EDAD ES ORIGINARIA DE AREA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE, DOÑA HERMINIA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS COMO ACTIVIDAD O TRABAJO SECUNDARIO POSEE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO DIARIO ESTA MUY CONTENTA PORQUE ES SU SEGUNDO CREDITO EN KIVA Y NO SE ATRAZO EN SUS PAGOS ELLA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES DE CONSUMO DIARIO Y PARA LA COMPRA DE ANIMALES PARA LA CRIANZA YA QUE POCO A POCO SU NEGOCIO A IDO CRECIENDO Y ESO ES GRACIAS AL CREDITO QUE LE OTORGARON EN KIVA/ FAPE ESPERA QUE NUEVAMENTE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO DE ANTEMANO LES AGRADESE POR LA AYUDA BRINDADA.
texts.en:
Duo Balles del Sargento

Herminia, 62 years old, is from San Martin Jilotepeque. She makes a living raising chickens and on the side she runs a small store with basic grocery items. Herminia is very happy because this is her second Kiva loan. In her previous loan cycle, she was punctual with all of her repayments. Herminia is requesting this loan in order to buy animals to raise so that little by little her business will continue growing. 

Thanks to Kiva, the bank FAPE hopes to again help Herminia by predisbursing her requested loan. Thank you for the support!

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and basic grocery items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 50, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Dionisio, an electrician, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth operates a market stall. She sells different vegetables like carrots, cabbage, potatoes, chayote, bitter melon and other vegetables. She also sells other products like soy sauce, vinegar, salt, sugar and other seasonings in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory.

Elizabeth hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have more customers. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and other products needed in her store.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Clarita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming/selling vegetables. Clarita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell for her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as well as in their everyday expenses. She is already a widow, and that's why she is working hard to provide for her and her children's everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 25,000 PHP, to buy more fish, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Corazon dreams that her children will have a good life and hopes that her business will continue to expand. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es: Eudocia tiene 37 años, esta casada con Lucio con quien tiene 2 hijos, juntos viven en una casa hecha a base de madera que heredó de su padre. Eudosia se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva algunos productos considerados como los más rentables de su zona como el cacao, cafe, entre otros. Actualmente cuenta con 2 hectáreas de terrenos repletos de cacao orgánico que mantiene en buen estado contando siempre con el apoyo de su esposo y de trabajadores del lugar para terminar las labores correspondientes en menos tiempo. Con el tiempo desea comprar un vehiculo para trasladar los sacos de cacao hasta la ciudad porque considera que el precio que le cobran los  transportistas de la zona son muy elevados. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con S/. 2000 soles para la compra de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Eudocia is 37 years old and she is married to Lucio with whom she has two children.  They live together in a house made out of wood that she inherited from her father.  Eudocia makes a living in agriculture.  She cultivates some products considered to be the most profitable in her area such as cacao and coffee, among others.  Currently she has 2 hectares of land filled with organic cacao that she maintains in a good condition always counting on the support of her husband and of local workers to complete the corresponding tasks in less time.  With time she wants to buy a vehicle to transport the sacks of cacao to the city because she thinks that the prices charged by carriers in her area are very high.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to move forward.  Also, she is committed to paying her installments in a punctual manner.  On this occasion she wants to have 2,000 soles (PEN) for the purchase of organic fertilizer to fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Pacita works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store and from selling nipa, woven palm mats used for house repairs and construction.
 
Pacita is borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She will use the loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Pacita has sustained her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada previously accessed a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase merchandise for her business. Her earnings were a big help toward her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise for her business, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. And her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. 

Iluminada looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams that her business will continue to grow and she hopes for a better standard of living. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. This is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.


*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 63 years old and married with four children.

Lily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, bread, chips, etc.

Lily has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from prepaid mobile load and farming rice.
 
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice farming business.

Lily aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, soft drinks, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, 35, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a vendor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Jesusa operates the buy-and-sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell the merchandise with a little profit. Her products are men’s and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise like men’s, women’s and children's clothing to expand her product inventory.

Jesusa dreams to expand her business and have her own stall. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners.The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of merchandise like men's, women's and children's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 48, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vivian operates a room rental business. The room is rented on a monthly basis. She also has a junk shop as a source of income. She earns a minimum of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will use the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. 

Vivian dreams to have a happy family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Nelia is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 50 años , está casada con Ronald y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en la casa que compraron hace 20 años. Durante todo este tiempo de trabajo arduo, pudo obtener muchas cosas entre ellas una botica por su localidad, donde vende medicinas y hace servicio de inyecciones y primeros auxilios, todo esto gracias a su hija mayor quien la ayuda en la administración del negocio. Pero su principal actividad es la agricultura, pues desde muy pequeña comenzó a producir la tierra, sus principales sembríos constan de papa y alfalfa que le sirve para la comida de sus vacas. Asimismo hace algunos meses, comenzó a vender comida típica los fines de semana en un local que alquila en su zona, donde su plato principal es la “pachamanca” plato típico a base de carne, papa, habas y maíz, el cual es cocinado con leña y muchas veces utiliza los mismos insumos que ella siembra, “cuando no me abastezco compró a otros agricultores”, afirma. Este es su nuevo proyecto y tiene la seguridad de que, saldrá adelante. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Luz, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de insumos para la preparación de su plato típico, además de más leña para calentar el hormo donde cocina los alimentos.
texts.en:
Luz is 50, married to Ronald, and has three children. They live together in the house they purchased 20 years ago. During all this time of hard work, they were able to earn some things, including a pharmacy that sells various medicines and does first aid and injection services. All of this is thanks to their older daughter who helps them in the administration of the business. 

But their main activity is agriculture. She has been farming since she was very small. Their principal crops are potatoes and alfalfa, which is for feeding the cows. 

At the same time, a few months ago, she started selling traditional food on the weekends in a location rents in her area. The main dish is “pachamanca,” a traditional food with meat, potatoes, broad beans, and corn. It is cooked with firewood, and a lot of times she uses the same ingredients that she grows. “When I don’t have it in stock, I purchase from other farmers,” she affirms. 

This is a new project and she is confident that she will be able to get ahead. This is her fourth loan with KIVA and she is thankful for the financial support that she receives to help her get ahead. In addition, she promises to complete her payments in a punctual manner. 

Luz will invest 3000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles in ingredients for the preparation of her dish, as well as more firewood to heat the oven where she cooks the food.

loans.use: purchase cooking ingredients and firewood for the oven

loans.name: Delyn

texts.en:
Delyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Delyn earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Delyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Bárbara tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, y vive en su casa propia junto sus padres y sus 3 hijos. Bárbara se dedica a la venta de jugos y refrescos. Tiene un pequeño puesto en un colegio de su barrio. Su principal clientela se concentra en los docentes de la institución que siempre la requieren para calmar su sed. Trabaja 2 años en esta actividad con ayuda de su hija mayor. Sus ganancias diarias son muy buenas y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita para sobrellevar los gastos que requiere la crianza de sus hijos menores. Su gran anhelo es poner una juguería en una zona céntrica y concurrida de la ciudad para vender mayor variedad de jugos y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ganancias económicas en beneficio de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas.  Se compromete a ser una socia puntual con cada uno de sus pagos. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará 2 sacos de naranjas y 2 sacos de piña para que pueda continuar preparando jugos.
texts.en:
Bárbara is 32, a single mother, and lives in her own home with her parents and her three children. Barbara sells juices and soft drinks. She has a small location in a school in her neighborhood. Her main customers are the teachers in the school that always need her to quench their thirst. She has done this work for 2 years with the help of her oldest daughter. 

Her daily earnings are very good, and this gives her the tranquility she needs to endure the expenses for raising her small children. Her biggest wish is to set up a juice store in an area in the city that is centrally located and crowded to be able to sell a greater variety of juices and at the same time, increase her earnings to benefit her family. 

On this occasion, she is requesting 600 Nuevos Soles. She is very happy to know that she has economic backing to continue advancing toward her goals. She promises to be a punctual borrower with each one of her payments. 

With the amount requested, she will purchase 2 sacks of oranges and 2 sacks of pineapples to be able to continue preparing juices.

loans.use: purchase 2 sacks of oranges and 2 sacks of pineapple to prepare juices for her business.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
Lita tiene 44 años, está casada y vive en casa de su suegra junta su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Lita se dedica a la compra y venta de diversos productos regionales como  piña, plátano, papaya, entre otros. Cada 2 ó 3 días se dirige al puerto de la ciudad en espera de la llegada de los agricultores. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 9 años y siempre con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de movilizar los pesados sacos que contienen los productos que consigue para vender durante la semana. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que desde muy pequeña ha aprendido a valorar el trabajo y a hacerle frente a las situaciones difíciles, su negocio le genera lo ingresos necesarios para sobrellevar los gatos básicos de su familia y espera que su situación económica siga mejorando con el paso de los días. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le ayuden continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad frutas regionales como papaya, piñas,  y cítricos por sacos para continuar trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lita is 44, married, and lives in the home of her mother-in-law together with her husband and three children. Lita purchases and sells diverse local products such as pineapples, bananas, papayas, and more. Every two or three days she goes to the port of the city to wait for the arrival of the farmers. She has had this business for 9 years and has always had the support of her husband, who is in charge of moving the heavy sacks that contain the products that she gets to sell during the week. 

She really likes what she does because since she was little she has learned the value of work and working in the face of difficult situations. Her business helps her make the income necessary to bear the basic household expenses, and she hopes that her economic situation will continue improving with each passing day. 

With this opportunity, she will request 1,000 Nuevos Soles. She is very moved to know that there are people that help her continue developing her work. At the same time, she commits to being a punctual and responsible borrower. With the amount requested, she will purchase a larger quantity of regional fruits such as papaya, pineapple, and citrus fruits by the sack to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase local fruits by the sack to sell in her business

loans.name: Negros Organic Rice Industry Association, Inc.

texts.en:
Ahmon and Leo (featured in the photo) are officers of Negros Organic Rice Industry Association, Inc. (NORIA), an association of organic rice farmers located on the island of Negros, Philippines. It is an SEC (Securities Exchange Commission) registered association with over 300 organic rice farmers from various parts of the island on its membership roster.

The majority of members have small landholdings – all below 4 hectares in size. Many have about a hectare, which they acquired from the government as Agrarian Reform Beneficiaries. 

With no economies of scale, it would have been practical for them to follow conventional methods using chemical fertilizers paired with a good dose of pesticides to boost their production. But in spite of the obvious hurdles organic farming entails, these small farmers made a conscious choice to convert their land into organic rice farms because they believe that going back to nature will ensure a healthier lifestyle for themselves, their families and communities.

Many of these organic practitioners also believe that this is the way to ensure food security of the island. They also believe that moving away from chemical fertilizers and pesticides protects the environment and encourages the biodiversity of the island. 

To ensure that the members benefit from the premium going organic provides, NORIA, led by its President, Ahmon, and Leo, head of the association’s Business Management Committee, is borrowing PHP 1,000,000.00 from NWTF. The group intends to use the money as a revolving credit line to purchase the organic rice harvest of its members. This ensures a fair price at the farm gate. 

By consolidating the harvest and milling the rice themselves, NORIA is protecting the integrity and provenance of the organic rice, and this will enable it to market the certified organic rice at a premium. At the moment this certified organic rice is sold at the Negros Occidental Organic Market, but will soon be available in supermarkets in Negros and the neighboring islands.

At present, the association has about 300 hectares of certified organic rice farms, but with the boost in their buying capacity, they are hoping to be able to encourage more farmers to go organic and increase their land area up to 1,000 hectares by the end of the year. 

NORIA has 3 main objectives: first, to strengthen the organic rice farming industry in Negros by providing training in the best organic farming practices, second – to strengthen economic development and sustainability of organic rice farmers through private-public partnerships; and third, to ensure that the price of organic rice is stable and fair at the farm gate.

NORIA is working hard to achieve Negros Island's vision of becoming the Organic Food Bowl of the Philippines.

loans.use: to purchase the organic rice harvest of the association's members at a fair price

borrowers.first_name: Negros Organic Rice Industry Association, Inc.

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
Yong is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a rural village of the Sa Ang district. Both of his daughters are in the area and still in school. 

Yong has been selling various kinds of fruit to make a living, while his wife works in a garment factory to supplement the family’s income. The current business earns his family the daily income of about 13,000KHR;  he is able to save 5,000KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Yong’s group of two members, and they both paid back the first loan with VisionFund. With the successful first loan, he has been able to support his family with enough food. 

He is now leading his group to apply for another loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy more fruit to sell. 

He hopes to earn more income to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rann's Group

texts.en:
Living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Rann is 48 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children. Currently, only one child still counts on her as that child is still in school.  

To meet the family’s needs, Rann runs a small food store selling Chinese noodles and porridge; it is the business which she has had for 10 years. Rann has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Rann will spend her loan portion to buy necessary ingredients for her food-selling business. She hopes that this purchase will support her business in a timely manner and get her  a good income.

loans.use: To buy necessary ingredients for her food-selling business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Lourdes has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from a general store.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, cream, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Normalita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

Normalita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, cream, sugar, soap, shampoo, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia amable, gentil y muy carismática que forma parte desde hace un año y medio del grupo de crédito 26-71, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada por grande paisajes, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es alegre y muy trabajadora que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre, y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos de 20,18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo sufre de una discapacidad por lo que pasa en casa, sus dos hijas siguientes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer por lo que presta sus servicios, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María es oriunda de la provincia de Esmeraldas y llego a esta ciudad hace 13 años, se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos topperware (plásticos) y cosméticos de leodine y yanbal, tiene este negocio 8 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos topperwere y cosmeticos para continuar creciendo en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María has been a kind, courteous, and charismatic member of credit group 26-71 for a year and a half now. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city surrounded by grand landscapes, which has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999. Its people are happy and very hard-working, yet they still maintain their culture and the traditions of their communities. 

María is 45 and is in a common-law marriage. She has three children with her husband, ages 20, 18, and 13. Her eldest son suffers from a disability, so he lives at home, while her two younger daughters are studying at a school in the city. Her husband works as a driver. They don't have their own house, so they rent. 

María is a native of the province of Esmeraldas, and she came to this city 13 years ago. She makes her living as a street vendor of Tupperware (plastic items) and cosmetics from Leodine and Yanbal. She has had this business for eight years and she works from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule. 

She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of Tupperware and cosmetics in order to continue growing her business.

Her dream is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Junelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from prepaid mobile phone loading and raising pigs. Junelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like noodles, soft drinks, chips, egg, etc. for her general store.

Junelyn has been sustaining her business activities with her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like noodles, soft drinks, chips, and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bolster her stock of vegetables

loans.name: Aitbubi

texts.ru: Айтбюби, 56 лет, замужем, имеет 1 сына. С 2009 года занимается реализацией кисло-молочной продукцией. Бизнес начала с 5000 сом(KGS). Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению, Айтбюби успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса, и ежемесячная прибыль составила 15000 сом(KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса  и приумножения прибыли Айтбюби обратилась в наш  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 60 000 сом(KGS),  на расширение торговли и подготовку продукции. На доходы от кредита Айтбюби хочет дать достойное образование сыну.
texts.en: Aitbubi is 56 years old, she is married and has one son. Since 2009 she has been selling dairy products. She started the business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work ethic and patience Aitbubi has successfully increased the size of her small business and her monthly profit now comes to 15,000 KGS. With a goal to further grow her business and multiply her profits Aitbubi has come to our microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som to expand selling and preparation of products. Aitbubi wants to give her son a deserving education using the income from the loan.

loans.use: purchase of dairy products.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 44 года, замужем, имеет трех детей (1 сын и 2 дочери). Образование среднее. Семья у Гулнары очень дружная и трудолюбивая. Более 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 7000 сом(KGS), благодаря ее терпению и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 9000 сом(KGS). В хозяйстве имеет 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 1 бычка и 1 теленка. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Гулнара обратилась к нам в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS,  на покупку  бычков для дальнейшего разведения и перепродажи. На доходы от кредита Гулнара хочет расширить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Gulnara is 44 years old, she is married and has three children (one son and two daughters). She has secondary education. Gulnara's family is very tight and hard working. For over twenty five years she has been doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation, a business she started with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her patience and love for work today she receives a monthly income in the amount of 9,000 som. She has two milk cows, two horses, one calf and one bull. With a goal to further increase the headcount of cattle Gulnara has come to our microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy calves for further breeding and sales. Gulnara wants to grow her business using the income from the loan.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 7 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe SABALI vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Tousseguela cercle de Kolondieba ( 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, grains, de savons et de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame AWA (assise sur la photo) est la vendeuse de condiments du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments  (boite de tomate concentrée, carton de cube Maggie et  oignon ).
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Madame compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Sabali Group is made up of seven married women who average 26 years of age and four children. They all live in traditional families in Tousseguela, Kolondieba Cercle (third administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community and marriage.

The members of the group buy and sell cereals, soaps, and condiments. With the aim of bolstering their working capital, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are now seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. AWA (sitting in the photograph) is the one selling condiments in the group. She intends to use her loan to buy condiments (boxes of tomato concentrate, boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, and onions). 

She gets her supplies from wholesalers and retails, for cash or on credit, at her home and at the market, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

Thanks to this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be in part reinvested in her business, and in part used to help her husband cover some family expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomato concentrate, Maggi bouillon cubes, and onions

loans.name: El Trebol Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado por tres  integrantes, emprendedores, cada socio  tiene  su propio  negocio, uno de ellos es José Luis joven de 38 años de edad, acompañado y con dos hijos menores. Su negocio es la de una panadería en su domicilio desde hace 4 años.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia  prima como harina, levaduras, azúcar, canela, rodamina, atados de dulces, leñas, reponer sartenes dañados por sartenes nuevos, etc. Norlan tiene 27 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa, Silvia tiene 46 años su negocio es la venta de sandalias.
texts.en: This is a group consisting of three members, entrepreneurs, each with his own business.  One of them is José Luis, 38, who has a spouse and two minor children.  His business is a home-based bakery he’s had for four years.  He will use the loan to buy raw materials like flour, yeast, sugar, cinnamon, food coloring, raw sugar, firewood and to replace damaged pans with new ones, etc.  Norlan, 27, sells clothes and Silvia, 46, sells sandals.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies and utensils.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo es un hombre emprendedor de 68 años de edad, casado. Su negocio es la agricultura siembra y venta de maíz por quintal y la venta de leña  desde hace 30 años. Tiene 12 años de ser cliente de la institución, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado y en su comunidad. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de activo fijo una moto sierra.
texts.en: Gerardo is an enterprising man who is 68 years old and is married.  He's had a business cultivating selling corn and selling firewood for 30 years.  He's been a client of ADIM for 12 years.  He sells his products in the market and in his community.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a fixed asset: a chainsaw.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa, a woven palm mat used in the Philippines for house repair and construction. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell in her nipa business.

Ederlinda has been in this business for 15 years. Ederlinda earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celeste is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

Celeste has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can allow her children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marlie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Marlie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store business like soap, toothpaste, milk, noodles, egg, spices, etc.
 
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice farming business.

Marlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, toothpaste, milk, noodles, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 34 years old and married with two children.

Maribeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, egg, spices, etc.

Maribeth has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Maribeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, milk, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Amylie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Amylie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Amylie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell in her banana business.

Amylie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Domecita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Domecita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Domecita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing and general store business.

Domecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling potato crops and farming rice. Amelita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her rice grains business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Nori Belen

texts.en:
Nori Belen is 57 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nori Belen is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

Nori Belen has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice and corn in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies for her rice and corn farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her rice and corn farming business and general store.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gulina

texts.ru: Гулина, 48 лет, замужем, имеет 1 дочь.  Занимается полеводством и животноводством на протяжении 25 лет, начав этот бизнес с 7 000 сом(KGS). В хозяйстве имеет: 4 дойные коровы и 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход от скотоводства составляет 9 000 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота Гулина обратилась к нам в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 120 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку коров для дальнейшего разведения и перепродажи. На доходы от кредита Гулина хочет приумножить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Guliana is a 48 year old married woman with one daughter. She has been farming and raising livestock for 25 years, and began her business with 7,000 somoni. Her farm has four dairy cows and five sheep. Her monthly income from her livestock is 9,000 somoni. To increase her livestock herd Guliana approached the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 120,000 somoni to purchase cows for further breeding and sale. With the income from her loan Juliana wants grow her farm.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe DEMBAGNOUMA vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et nucléaires avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondieba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, chaussures, de baigné, draps et de condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame RAMATA (2ème à gauche sur la photo) est la vendeuse de condiments du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments  (boite de tomate concentrée, carton de cube Maggie, oignon et du sel de cuisine.).
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Madame RAMATA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma group is made up of 4 married women who live in traditional, nuclear families and have an average age of 37 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in the town of Kolondieba (a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships, and marriage. The group members are small retailers who sell shoes, doughnuts, sheets and condiments. The group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their 3rd group loan.

Ramata (sitting second from the left in the picture) is the group member who sells condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy condiments (tins of tomato concentrate, boxes of Maggie stock cubes, onions and kitchen salt). She gets her supplies from the wholesalers and makes her sales door-to-door and at the market for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up mostly of women. Thanks to this loan, Ramata expects to make an average monthly profit of 11 500 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MASSALA, un des villages de KEBILA-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est :’arachide  avec MINATA SALIF 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi I group are married women with an average age of 42 and, on average, 5 children, who all live in polygamous families in Massala, one of the villages of Kebila (Kolondieba prefecture, 3rd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Minata Salif, standing on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold at the village market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 85 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay labour wages.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MASSALA, un des villages de KEBILA-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec FILLY  1ère à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi II group are married women with an average age of 36 and, on average, 5 children, who all live in polygamous families in Massala, one of the villages of Kebila (Kolondieba prefecture, 3rd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Filly, standing on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Kolondieba to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 85 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay labour wages.

loans.name: Faso Djigui I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASO DJIGUI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOUARAN, un des villages de KEBILA-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec  KADIATOU 3ème à droite  assise sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Faso Djigui I Group are married women who average 36 years of age and 3 children. They all live in polygamous families in N’Gouaran, one of the villages in Kebila, Kolondieba Prefecture, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Kadiatou (third woman sitting on the right in the photograph) is growing rice. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and in Kolondieba, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 85'000 (ca US$ 170) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Faso Djigui Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASO DJIGUI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOUARAN, un des villages de KEBILA-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  MAYATOU 1ère assise à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Faso Djigui II Group are married women who average 36 years of age and 3 children. They all live in polygamous families in N’Gouaran, one of the villages in Kebila, Kolondieba Prefecture, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Mayatou (first woman sitting on the left in the photograph) is growing peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain two hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and in Kolondieba, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 145'500 (ca US$ 290) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan and help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Faso Djigui Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASO DJIGUI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOUARAN, un des villages de KEBILA-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  DJENEBA 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Faso Djigui III Group are married women who average 28 years of age and 3 children. They all live in polygamous families in N’Gouaran, one of the villages in Kebila, Kolondieba Prefecture, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Djeneba (first woman standing on the left in the photograph) is growing rice. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain two hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and in Kolondieba, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 145'500 (ca US$ 290) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Faso Djigui Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASO DJIGUI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOUARAN, un des villages de KEBILA-Préfecture de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  CHATA 1ère assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à  KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 85'500 (ca US$ 170) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

The members of the Faso Djigui V II group are married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in N'Gouaran, one of the villages in Kebila (Kolondieba prefecture, 3rd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

Mariam Dramane, standing on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of 2 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Kolondieba to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 145 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay labour wages.

La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  KADIDIA 1ère assise à droite sur la photo.
