The members of the Benkadi I group are married women with an average age of 42 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Samba, one of the villages in Kebila (Kolondieba prefecture, 3rd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 2nd loan from the institution. The previous loan has been correctly repaid.

Kadidia, sitting on the right in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Kolondieba to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 45 500 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay labour wages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish and rice for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as corn in bulk, firewood, men's and women's clothing, Avon cosmetics, body lotion, hand lotion, etc.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert tiene 27 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus hermanos. Robert tiene un mototaxi que conduce a diario por las calles de la ciudad en busca de pasajeros que requieren trasladarse de un lugar a otro. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 2 años desde el momento que compró su primer vehículo gracias a un crédito privado. Todo ese tiempo que lleva laborando le ha servido para generar sus propios recursos económicos y tiene clientes muy fieles gracias a su calidad de trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, no tiene un horario de trabajo estricto que cumplir, obtiene su propio dinero con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar. Aún así tiene muchas ganas de seguir progresando y con mucho esfuerzo desea establecer más adelante una tienda de repuestos de mototaxi para complementar su trabajo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado renovará el toldo y el tapizado que necesita su herramienta de trabajo para que funcione en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Robert is 27 years old, he is single, and he lives in his parent's house with his brothers and sisters.  Robert has a moto-taxi that he drives daily in the city streets in search of passengers that need transportation from one location to another.  He has been doing this work for 2 years, since the moment that he bought his first vehicle, thanks to a private loan.  In all of the time that he has been working, he has been able to make his own money and he has acquired loyal customers due to the quality of his work.

What he likes about his job is that he works independently.  He doesn't have a strict schedule and he earns his own money which he uses to help pay his family's household expenses.  Still, he has dreams to continue building his business and with a lot of effort he hopes to one day open a moto-taxi repair shop to complement his work.

He is now seeking a loan of 500 soles.  He is thankful for all of the people that are supporting him with this loan, since he needs it to reach his goals.  He promises to comply with the repayment schedule.  With the loan money, he will renovate the awning and upholstery of his moto-taxi so that he can transport his customers in optimal conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the awning and upholstery of his moto-taxi so that it is in a better condition.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 58 años es una mujer sencilla. Tiene 4 hijos pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en la casa que compró hace 20 años. Gracias a su buena disposición para el trabajo logró abrir una empresa de helados en la selva, lograr adquirir la franquicia de estos helados y en compañía de sus hijas distribuye de estos productos a su ciudad. Ya tiene 9 vendedores por todo el país y comenta ser muy afortunada pues cada día vende más y muy pronto podrá comprar más carritos, por lo que desea capital de trabajo para abastecer los pedidos que tiene. Su fábrica se ubica en su casa por lo que no paga alquiler . Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida con el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Silvia, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra carritos que sirven para vender los helados.
texts.en:
Silvia is 58 years old and she is a very humble woman.  She has 4 children but she lives with only 2 of them in the home that she bought 20 years ago.  Thanks to her hard-working character, she was able to open an ice cream business in the jungle.  She got into an ice cream franchise, and with the help of her daughters, she distributes her products around the city.  

She already has 9 employees that sell the ice cream across the country and she says that she feels very fortunate because every day she sells more and more.  Very soon she will need to buy more carts.  She needs funds so that she can fulfill the orders she has received.  Her workshop is in her home so that she doesn't need to pay rent.

This is her first loan from Kiva and she is thankful for the support that she is receiving so that she can continue to get ahead.  She promises to comply with the repayment schedule and pay punctually.  Silvia will invest 2000 soles in the purchase of carts so that she can sell ice cream.

loans.use: to buy carts in order to sell ice cream.

loans.name: Greda Trader's Two Group

texts.en:
Note: The photo shows all 14 members of Greda Trader's Group. This loan is for a subgroup of six of the 14 members. 

The Greda Trader's Two Group consists of six members from the original Greda Trader's Group created on November 23rd, 2011. It is composed of five women and one man from the Greda Estate at Teshie. They all work in commerce, and maintain good relationships within the group. The group needs a total of GHS 6,800 to expand their businesses in the second stage of loan cycle from Kiva. 

Emmanuel is shown at the back of the group balancing a car tyre on his head. He is 43 years old and married with three children, all boys. The oldest of his children is 11, and the youngest is 5. Emmanuel sells tyres of various kinds and also spare parts for cars. With this loan, he is going to buy three sets of car tyres worth GHS 2,000, but will need GHS 1,500 from Kiva so that he can top up with GHS 500. The profits he gets will be used to bolster his savings at the ID Ghana, and help his to take care of his family.

loans.use: To buy three sets of car tyres to sell to customers.

loans.name: Noyaa 1 Group

texts.en:
Teley sells fish and she is requesting a loan of GHS 1,100 to purchase two cartons of fish so she can smoke and resell them. Teley has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

Teley is 41 years old and married with three children. She and her family live in Teshie. This is her sixth loan with ID-Ghana and second with Kiva. She has repaid the previous loans without any difficulty.

Since Teley joined this group, her finances have improved but she still needs this loan to support her business. 

With her business profits, Teley hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her children and to be able to buy more fish and sell them to customers.

The other group member is Prince who sells provisions. Together, they need a total amount of GHS 2,100 to continue their businesses.

loans.use: To be able to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.  Rebecca is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF to buy soap, milk, shampoo, noodles, egg, and other items to sell.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, shampoo, noodles, egg, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of yams and plantains.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 49 years old and married with five children.

Nellie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like spices, chips, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc.

Nellie has borrowed and paid back15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nellie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like spices, chips, snack foods, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, noodles, eggs, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, noodles, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more stock such as sardines, snack foods, eggs, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Emelyn has been in this business for 3 years. Emelyn earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as sardines, snack foods, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa [palm leaves]. Gloria is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from renting a boarding house. Elsa is borrowing 26,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional soap, milk, coffee, canned goods, chips, and other items to sell. 

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional soap, milk, coffee, canned goods, chips, and other items to sell.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Sitan (second woman sitting in the photograph) is growing peanuts. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to farm 2.5 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and in Kolondieba, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 145'500 (ca US$ 290) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 55 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Lita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maelynn

texts.en:
Maelynn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she earns more income from selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to to buy more grocery items like coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Maelynn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 38 ans et mère de deux enfants.elle est cuoturière de profession et n'est pas à son prémier crédit. etant donné qu'elle a été satisfaite de son prémier crédit,elle sollicite un  autre crédit qui puisse l'aider à augmenter son stock de tissu afin de satisfaire la forte demande à laquelle elle fait face en cette période de Ramadan de même que améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose is a 38-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She's a professional seamstress and this is not her first loan. Indeed, having been satisfied with her first loan, she's now seeking another one in order to help her bolster her stock of fabrics.

This will enable her to meet the high demand she's experiencing during this Ramadan period, as well as help her improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth (colorful African cloth) and sundry sewing supplies

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. Nena dreams of saving money for business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Greyler

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Greyler works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and from farming sugarcane. Greyler is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of charcoal for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Greyler has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns more income from buying and selling nipa (palm leaves).

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Lynie dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 35 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like canned goods, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

Maribeth has borrowed and paid off 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and making nipa. (palm leaf thatch)

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like canned goods, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and from farming rice. Norma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal for her charcoal business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she earns more income from selling prepaid mobile load and from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy foods and household goods to sell, like canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy foods and household goods to sell, like canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila vive en la provincia de Paucartambo a  3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada, ella saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Domitila lives in the province of Paucartambo, three hours away from the city of Cusco.  She is 53 years old, married, and gets her family ahead in life with a lot of effort and dedication since her main job is agriculture and livestock.  She has several plots of land where she plants potatoes, barley, wheat, etc.  For several years she has made a living through this business and it is going well thanks to the determination she puts into her work.  She belongs to the communal bank "Santa Ana".  At this time she needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She is grateful and appreciates the loan, and promises to complete the monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for food, clothing, and education for his children.

loans.name: Analeah

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Analeah works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and from selling charcoal. Analeah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her buy-and-sell vegetable, general store and selling charcoal businesses. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell through her business. 

Analeah hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a plumber who offers and provides good services to his customers. He acquired this career from his father. He works nearly all day and is happy to continue this career. He would like to improve his business. He has requested a youth loan of 340,000 YER from AMB to buy plumbing tools and construction materials to use in his career. With this he hopes to have a more respectable home and to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy plumbing tools and construction materials for use in his career.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es: De la edad de 32 años es Edith, habita en anexo de Villa Libertad, es una zona marginal de Managua, ella es madre soltera su hijo tiene 11 años de edad estudia el sexto grado de primaria, con su labor como despachadora en una tienda, espera poder darles todos sus estudios a su hijo. Así también Edith tiene mucha necesidad de levantar una pared de su casa el cual se está cayendo por la mala construcción. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en materiales para hacer la mejora en su hogar, lo que le permitirá seguridad, tranquilidad y comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Edith is 32 years old.  She lives in an annex of Villa Libertad which is a poor area of Managua.  She is a single mother.  Her child is 11 years old and is in the 6th grade of elementary school. With her job as a baggage handler in a store, she hopes to be able to provide for all of her child's education.  

Edith also has a great need to raise a wall of her house which is falling down due to bad construction.  She is requesting a loan to be able to invest in materials to make improvements to her house which will enable her to have safety, tranquility and comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar and cinderblocks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, de 34 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y de su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeño aprendió de su padre el arte del pintado, desde entonces práctica este oficio. Comenta que a pesar de tener oportunidades para dedicar su vida a otros trabajos, siempre estuvo firme en el trabajo con la brocha y el arte. Posee una empresa pequeña que trabaja con licitaciones y contratos en la selva central, “tenemos poca competencia en esta parte del país”, afirma. Es así que le va muy bien en su negocio, por lo que desea muy pronto poder comprar las maquinas necesarias para acelerar el tiempo de su trabajo y así conseguir mejores contratos, comenta que su secreto es estar pendiente de la calidad por lo que trabaja con un arquitecto de manera permanente. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecido con el apoyo recibido por lo que promete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Freddy, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de una máquina comprensora para poder pintar con mayor rápidez.
texts.en:
Freddy is 34 years old and is a responsible individual. He lives with his parents and young child in his own home. He learned how to paint from his father from a young age and since then he has practised this trade. He says that although he had opportunities to work in other jobs, he always wanted to work with paintbrushes and art. He has a small business that works with tenders and contracts in the central rainforest, “we have little competition in this part of the country", he explains.

His business is doing very well, which is why he would soon like to buy the machines he needs to speed up his work and in this way, secure better contracts. He says that he secret is prioritizing quality, which is why he always works with an architect. This is his first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the support received. For this reason, he promises to pay his loan repayments on time. Freddy will invest the money in buying a compressing machine to paint quicker.

loans.use: to buy a compressor machine for painting.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina vive en la provincia de Paucartambo a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada, ella saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es  brindar servicio de transporte interprovincial,  ella tiene un carro que alquila para que los demás pobladores brindan servicio de transportes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro entonces va hacer cambiar de aceite y verificación de frenos. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Paulina lives in the province of Paucartambo, three hours from the city of Cusco. She is 62 years old and is married. 

With much effort and dedication she helps her family to get ahead. As her main business activity, she provides an interprovincial transportation service. She has a vehicle that she rents out so that other residents can provide the transport service. She has been in this business for several years already and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

She belongs to the communal Bank "Santa Ana" and on this occasion she requires a loan to perform maintenance on the vehicle - an oil change and a brake inspection. 

She is thankful and appreciative of the loan and is committed to making the monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her vehicle - an oil change and brake inspection.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 50 años es una mujer trabajadora, enviudó hace 6 años, tuvo 8 hijos pero solo vive con una de ellas en la comunidad nativa donde nació. Como mujer mayor y trabajadora vive de la venta de la artesanía que confecciona, por lo que afirma ser una mujer muy feliz, pues pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo mostrando a los turistas el lugar donde nació y las maravillas naturales de la zona, “compartir mi pueblo con los demás me hace muy feliz”, comenta. Recibe muchos turistas en épocas festivas y durante todo el año, a veces la acogida es demasiada y numerosa, por lo que se quedan sin artesanía para vender, razón por lo que pensó en comprar insumos al por mayor para elaborar los collares, pulseras, bolsas, fechas y demás accesorios que tiene mucha demanda en estos meses. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida con el apoyo recibido por lo que promete pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Rebeca, invertirá S/.1000 soles en la compra de hilos e insumos para la elaboración de la artesanía que posee.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 50 years old and is a hard-working woman. She was widowed 6 years ago, and has 8 children, but only one of them lives with her in the native community in which she was born. As a hard-working older woman, she makes a living from the sale of handicrafts she produces. She says she really enjoys this, because she spends most of her time showing tourists around where she was born and the natural wonders of the area. "Sharing my village with others makes me very happy", she explains.

There are a lot of tourists in festive seasons and throughout the whole year. Sometimes there are so many people that they sell out of handicrafts, which is why she wants to buy wholesale items to make necklaces, bracelets, bags and other accessories in demand during busy times. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the support received. For this reason, she promises to make her loan repayments on time. Rebeca will invest the money in buying threads and other items to make her handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy threads and other items to make her handicrafts.

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en: Nemie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell. Nemie has been in this business for nine years. Nemie earns additional income from pig fattening. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for an additional loan to further build her charcoal and pig businesses. Nemie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en: Florenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more bags of rice to sell in her business. Florenda has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods and by farming vegetables. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her businesses. Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: As a married parent of two children who are in school, Elma works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop and by farming vegetables. Elma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional bags of rice to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her rice and other businesses. Elma has been sustaining her business activities with her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough so she can afford  to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 30-year-old single man. He has completed secondary school. He is very hardworking and is doing his best to earn money. However, he is unable to buy some furniture and home appliances for his house, because what he earns is hardly enough to cover his family's daily expenses. He decided to apply for a 100,000 YER loan to buy some furniture for his house. He hopes that his life conditions will improve and that he will find capital to buy and sell products.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for his house.

loans.name: Jeanylyn

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Jeanylyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening and by farming rice. Jeanylyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more bags of rice to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her businesses. Jeanylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Elizabeth has been fattening pigs for five years and earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Teodora works hard to support her family. She has an itinerant fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening. Teodora is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish in sell her business. Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sahar Group

texts.en: There are five women members of the Sahar Group. They live in Hadramout, Yemen. Wajida, the leader of group, has a tailoring business. She is a 19-year-old. While running the business is difficult, she has been able to make a sufficient profit, which has helped her take care of her needs. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Lamis Group

texts.en: Lamis Group consists of five women who live in Hadramout, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to be apportioned among the group members. Aida is 49 years old, a married woman. She owns a small house, which she would like to add onto and renovate. She will use her 30,000 YER portion to buy construction materials to use on her house. She hopes this project will be successful.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to add onto and renovate her house.

loans.name: Wanasa Group

texts.en: This group is called Wanasa and is composed of four ladies. They applied for a loan of 210,000 Yemeni Rials (YER). Zahra lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is 29 years old and married. She has been selling clothes, perfumes and incense for ladies. She is a professional in this field, and her goods are sought after in the market. She started her business with little capital. She is applying for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for her business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for her business.

loans.name: Nonsi

texts.es: Nonsi, de 26 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de Elsa, su esposa. Ambos tienen una hija con quien viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que dedicó 8 años de su vida es la construcción de casas. Desde muy joven encontró la manera de subsistir en el oficio de albañil, gracias a su trabajo pudo ahorrar y comprar sus propias cosas. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo conoce muchos lugares y ciudades, “trabajo no me falta, cuando termino de construir una casa, tengo otra en pendiente; por eso espero tener mayor capital de trabajo para poder proyectarme a mejores obras”, afirma. Ahora desea comprar las máquinas que necesita para elaborar con mayor rapidez sus trabajos. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Nonsi, invertirá S/. 3000 soles en la compra de madera al por mayor para realizar las construcciones.
texts.en: Nonsi, 26, is a responsible man.  He lives with Elsa, his wife, and they have a daughter who lives with them in their own house.  Nonsi has earned his living in home construction for 8 years.  From an early age he learned to support himself in construction, and thanks to his work he was able to save up and buy his own things.  He says that thanks to his work he's familiar with lots of places and cities.  "I never lack for work," he says.  "When I finish building a house I've got another waiting, which is why I hope to have more working capital so I can set my sights on better jobs." Now he wants to buy the machines he needs to do his work more quickly.  This is his second KIVA loan and he is grateful for the financial support he receives to get ahead.  He also promises to make his payments on time.  Nonsi will invest the 3000 soles to buy wood wholesale for his job.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Sibekiwe

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Sibekiwe from Bulawayo. She is widowed and stays with her three children. Her two elder children go to a local school. 

Sibekiwe runs a retail business selling shoes, skirts, shirts, jackets and jeans for men, women and children. She also sells handbags. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges she faces are lack of working capital and high import duties. 

Sibekiwe has requested a loan of $500 to order a variety of stock and increase her business capacity. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her more income to buy food, pay rent and fees for the children in school. 

In the future Sibekiwe plans to expand and open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy, shoes, skirts, jackets, jeans, and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Osman Gabriel

texts.es: Osman, tiene la edad de 23 años es habitante del Reparto Chick, un barrio donde hay mucha delincuencia, en su mayoría los pobladores son personas de escasos recursos, el es soltero sin hijos, trabaja como bartender en una discoteca, su deseo es terminar sus estudios y después formar su  familia. Solicita el crédito para construir su propio cuarto en la parte trasera de su casa, para tener privacidad y comodidad.
texts.en: Osman is 23 and lives in Reparto Chick, a neighborhood with a high crime rate, and in which the majority of inhabitants have limited resources. He is single, with no children, and works as a bartender in a club. His dream is to complete his studies and then have a family. He is requesting the loan to buy his own room in the back of the house, so that he has privacy and is comfortable.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, blocks, iron, sand, zinc and beams.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De Negocio Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES DE NEGOCIO
El grupo está conformado por la señora Ana Dela de 37 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa típica (cortes, güipiles delantales etc.) y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos (perfumería y cosméticos)se a dedica a estas actividades desde hace 20 años,  solicita otro crédito para invertir más en su ventas y tener variedad de productos tanto en la venta de ropa tipica como en la de perfumeria y cosmeticos y de esa forma aprovechar el mes de junio ya que es la ferias del pueblo donde vive,y de esa forma incrementar sus ventas  sus sueño es seguir luchando y tener un negocio mas grande y mas productivo por medio de sus ventas y poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos menores  que aun tiene a su cargo ya a trabajado con creditos en Kiva/Fape y le han sido de mucha bendicion en su negocio y no a quedado en mora espera que como la han apoyado en su negocio atravez de los credito le den esa ayuda nuevamente.
texts.en:
Women of Business Duo.  The group is comprised in part of Ana Dela who is 37 years old and who makes a living selling traditional clothing (skirts, huipils, aprons, etc.) and as a secondary activity she sells products by catalogues (perfumes and cosmetics).  She has worked in these activities for 20 years.

She is requesting another loan to invest more in her sales and to have a variety of products both in traditional clothing and in perfumes and cosmetics and in this way take advantage of the month of June since there are markets in the town where she lives and in this way she will increase her sales.  Her dream is to continue striving and to have a larger and more productive business by means of her sales and to be able to get ahead with her 2 young children that she still has in her care.  

She has already worked with loans from Kiva and Fape and they have given her many blessings in her business and she has not been in default.  She hopes that since they have supported her in her business through the loan that they will give her that help again.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ana, es una mujer trabajadora quien durante años trabaja haciendo comida para vender, como madre soltera tuvo que  trabajar sin descansar para poder darles el alimento diario a sus hijos, hoy en día son mayores de edad e independientes. Ana en la actualidad vende totillas de maíz, cuajada y frijoles cocidos, elaborados por ella. El crédito que solicita es para mantener sus ingresos de este pequeño negocio, necesita comprar maíz por quintal ya que le sale más barato y cuajadas por libras para  vender y mantener sus ingresos diario.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working woman who has worked for years preparing food to sell. As a single mother, she had to work without rest to be able to provide daily sustenance to her children. Now, her children are adults and independent. Ana currently sells corn tortillas, curds, and cooked beans, prepared by her.

The loan that she is requesting is to maintain her income from this small business. She needs to buy corn by the 100 lbs. since it is cheaper, and curds by the pound to sell and maintain her daily income.

loans.use: to buy corn by the 100 lbs., beans, and curds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 54 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Juan y sus 4 hijos; de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa alquilada.  
Durante 6 años, dedicó su tiempo y esfuerzo a mejorar su situación económica. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. En sus propios terrenos agrícolas siembra, papa, maíz y habas los cuales fertilizan, cuida y cosecha con mucho esmero, pues sabe, que obtendrá la recompensa durante la venta de sus alimentos en el mercado de la ciudad. Cuenta que ella misma traslada sus alimentos para negociarlos, “tengo que aprovechar la venta y negociar a un mayor precio”, comenta. Asimismo cría animales como cerdos y ovejas, los cuales engorda para luego vender su carne. Gracias a esta actividad obtiene ingresos estables para mantener los gastos familiares. Ahora desea incrementar el capital de trabajo, con el que podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, durante todo este tiempo, logró avanzar en su negocio y adquirir ganancias para el futuro de sus hijos, por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. María, invertirá los S/.4000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
María, 54, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Juan, and their four children, only two of whom live with them in their rented house.  

For the past six years María has dedicated her time and effort to improving her economic situation.  She and her husband earn their living farming and raising livestock.  On their own land they grow potatoes, corn, and beans, which they painstakingly fertilize, look after, and harvest because they know they'll be rewarded when they sell their products at the city market.  María says that she herself transports the produce to be sold. "I have to make the most of the sale and fetch the best price," she says.  She also raises animals including pigs and sheep, which she fattens up so she can sell the meat later on.  Thanks to her business, María brings in a steady income to keep up with household expenses.  Now she wants to increase her working capital so she can have higher profits.  

This is her third Kiva loan, and during all this time she has managed to advance herself in her business and bring in money for her children's futures, so she promises to be punctual with her payments.  María will invest the 4000 soles in organic fertilizer for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jonave

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jonave works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fish. 

Jonave is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, milk, soap, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested a new loan to further build her general store and fish vending business.

Jonave has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like canned goods, milk, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Juanita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice. 

Wilma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Victoria earns additional income from food vending and farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old and married with five children.

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice and selling duck eggs. 

Betty requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, spices, vegetables, etc.

Betty has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Betty aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora. Tiene 4 hijos pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en la casa . Posee una casa a la entrada de su localidad, ella desea abrir un recreo campestre en esa zona, pero carece de capital de trabajo, “con el tiempo ahorraré el dinero suficiente para poder hacer realidad mi sueño”, afirma. Elvira se dedica a la artesanía. Todos los fines de semana y en días festivos recibe muchos turistas que visitan el lugar y compran la artesanía que elabora. Además vende bebidas curativas con plantas nativas, las que resultan eficientes para algunas enfermedades por lo que es conocida y no solo recibe la visita de turistas, también de pobladores de las diferentes ciudades. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Elvira, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de telas e hilos para la elaboración de las bolsas artesanales.
texts.en:
Elvira is a 38-year-old, hard-working woman. She has four children but only lives with two of them in her home. She owns a home at the entrance to her neighborhood. She wishes to open a country leisure center in this area, but lacks work capital. “With time, I will save enough money to be able to make my dream a reality,” she affirms.

Elvira works in handicrafts. Every weekend and on holidays, she receives many tourists that visit her area and buy the handicrafts that she produces. Furthermore, she sells therapeutic drinks with native plants which are effective for some diseases. She is known for these drinks, and not only receives visits from tourists, but also from the inhabitants of the different cities.

This is her first loan from Kiva, and she is thankful for the financial support that she is receiving to continue forward. Furthermore, she promises to make her payments punctually. Elvira will invest the 2500 Nuevo Soles in the purchase of cloth and thread for the production of her handcrafted bags.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread to produce handcrafted bags.

loans.name: Djouraton I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DJOURATON I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NALA, un des quartiers  de FAKOLA ville, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec AWA 1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djouraton I group are all married women averaging 36 years of age, with three children. They all live in polygamous families in Nala, a neighborhood in the town of Fakola, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow peanuts, which is the case of Awa, for example. She is the first one standing on the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds and pay the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land. After harvesting, the produce is sold locally, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn 85,000 West African franc per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs and seeds as well as for the cost of farm labor.

loans.name: Mduduzi

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 30-year-old Mduduzi from Bulawayo. He is married and has two children. Their first born attends primary school and is in grade 1. 

Mduduzi runs a retail business selling footwear and clothes. The business has been in operation for almost 10 years. He says the main challenges he faces are competition from bigger retailers who offer longer credit terms and also high import duties when bringing goods from outside the country. 

Mduduzi has requested a loan of $500 to order a variety of stock of clothes and footwear items. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him more disposable income to buy food and pay rent and fees for the child in school. 

In the future Mduduzi plans open more stalls around town and a clothes boutique.

loans.use: to order, various clothing items and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Jovelin

texts.en:
Jovelin is 33 years old and married. She has two children.

Jovelin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her general store and her buy and sell charcoal business.

Jovelin requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase food and household goods to sell like soap, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

Jovelin has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jovelin aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase food and household goods to sell like soap, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 28,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Emelyn has been in this business for 12 years. Emelyn earns more income from pig fattening and selling meat.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a hardworking entrepreneur sells vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Virgie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is 24 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Haidee is borrowing 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies.

Haidee has been farming rice for 1 year and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rahaf Group

texts.en: Rahaf group is a group of five ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. Samira is a 41-year-old mother of four children. She started her work last year as a door-to-door clothing seller when her husband became disabled to cover all his family's expenses. So, she decided to assist her husband to cover their family's expenses. Recently, she decided she would like to expand her business. She has applied for a loan in order to buy clothes for her business. This extra profit will help to start her up for the next season, which in return will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Света, 52 года, разведена, имеет 3 детей (2 дочери, 1 сын). Разведением скота занимается с 1999 года, начав этот бизнес с 4000 сом(KGS). Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 6000 сом(KGS). В хозяйстве у Светы имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь и 5 овец. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Света обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку коров для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Света хочет сделать ремонт своего дома.
texts.en: Sveta is 52 years old, divorced and has three children (two daughters and a son).  She has worked with cattle since 1999, having started her business with 4,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and endurance, today she has a monthly profit of 6,000 KGS.  Among her animals, she has two dairy cows, one horse and five sheep.  With the goal of expand her herd, Sveta has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cows to breed.  She wants to use the income from the loan to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy cows and to do home repairs

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу, 68 лет, вдова. После распада Союза, и потеряв работу, Калбубу в поиске доходов для своей семьи стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 10 000 сом(KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Калбубу достигла небольших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10 000 сом(KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Калбубу имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 20 овец. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел на обработку и посадку фасоли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калбубу обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40 000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений ГСМ. Доходы от кредита Калбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого бизнеса.
texts.en: Kalbubu is a 68 year old widow. After the dissolution of the Soviet Union she lost her job and to find a steady income to support her family she began farming and raising animials. She began her business with 10,000 somoni. Thankfully through her back-breaking labor and tireless work Kalbubu achieved a little progress and began to make a profit of 10,000 somoni a month. Nowadays on the farm Kalbubu has two cows and twenty sheep. She also had allotted land for planting and processing beans. In order to further develop her business, Kalbubu is appealing to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 40,000 somoni to buy fertilizer and fuel. Income from the loan Kalbubu plans to invest in the development of their small business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Dúo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es:
Dúo El Manzanillo,
Formado por la señora Justa de 28 años de edad madre soltera tiene dos niños, vive en una aldea de Santiago Sacatepequez, Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, y venta de granos básicos, azúcar, frijol, maíz, pastas, se ha dedicado al negocio ya que de esa forma ha podido sacar adelante a su familia su negocio tiene 4 años funcionando, ahora ella desea poder invertir un capital en venta de golosinas y gaseosas, como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas solo al medio dia es decir solo un tiempo ya que su tiempo se buelve demasiado corto al atender dos negocios al mismo tiempo, le da gracias a Dios por haberle ayudado con su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta ya que desea aumentar su negocio para generar un poco mas de ganacias esto para que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida, es su primer oportunidad que solicita la ayuda de kiva espera que le puedan ayudar a superarse un poco más atravez del credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo El Manzanillo

This group was formed by Justa, a 28-year-old single mother of two children. She lives in a small village of Santiago Sacatepequez. She sells chicken, and also sells basic grains, sugar, beans, corn, and pasta. She has worked in this business since it has allowed her to bring her family out ahead. Her business has been open for four years. 

Now, she wishes to be able to invest capital in selling candy and soda. As a secondary activity, she produces and sells tortillas only at midday, that is, only for a time since her time is too short to attend to two businesses at the same time. She gives thanks to God for having helped her with her business. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase grocery products for selling, since she wishes to grow her business to generate a little more profit. This is so that her children have a better quality of life. This is her first opportunity to request help from Kiva, and she hopes that they can help her to improve herself a little more through the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, and to purchase chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has buys and sells firewood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Marissa is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood to sell. Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Meri Rose

texts.en:
Meri Rose is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from selling rice.


Meri Rose is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to restock her store with food and household goods like soap, toothpaste, eggs, and noodles. Meri Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to restock her store with food and household goods like soap, toothpaste, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: Martine est une femme qui vit dans un quartier de la capitale. Mère de famille, elle gère un call-box dans un coin de la place depuis 02ans. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa témérité, elle s'est faite une grande dont elle aimerait continuer d'assurer la satisfaction. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt pour acquérir une plus grande quantité de crédit de communication et des lignes supplémentaires( SE, camtel, etc..) . Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et d'améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Martine is a woman who lives in a district of the capital. A mother, she has been managing a call box in a corner of the square for the past two years. Thanks to her dynamic personality and temerity, she has acquired a large clientele whose satisfaction she would like to continue to ensure. In order to do this, she is seeking a loan to acquire a larger quantity of communication credits and additional lines (SE, Camtel, etc.). The income generated by this loan will enable her to increase her capital and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to acquire a larger quantity of communication credits and additional lines (SE, Camtel, etc.).

loans.name: Djouraton Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DJOURATON II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NALA, un des quartiers  de FAKOLA ville, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  MAYAMOU GAMA 1ère assise à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djouraton II Group are married women with an average age of 43 years, and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families in Nala, one of the districts in the city of Fakola, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their seventh loan cycle, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Mayamou Gama, shown seated on the far left in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 85,500 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Sonkoma I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA I   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  DIATOU SAMBA  1ère assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sonkoma I Group are married women with an average age of 36 years, and an average of three children. They are all living in polygamous families in Togodaba, one of the villages in Fakola, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fourth loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Diatou Samba, shown seated on the far right in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain two hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 145,500 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain two hectares of farmland.

loans.name: Sonkoma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA II   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  MASSITAN AMARA  1ère assise à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sonkoma II Group are married women with an average age of 36 years, and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families in Togodaba, one of the villages in Fakola, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fourth loan with the institution, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Massitan Amara, shown seated on the far right in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain two hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 145,500 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain two hectares of farmland.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.fr: Roseline est une femme de 41 ans   et mère de 02 enfants mais ayant a 04 personnes à sa charge. elle vend de  la tomate  et des épices dans un marché de la place depuis 13 ans.elle est confrontée actuellement à un  problème de rupture de stock ne lui permettant pas de satisfaire la demande.elle sollicite donc un crédit pour acheter la marchazndise en grande quantité. ce qui lui permetra de réaliser de bénéfices qui en retour rembourseront le crédit et lui permettront d'évoluer.
texts.en: Roseline is a 41 year old woman and the mother of two children, but has a total of four dependents in her care. She has been selling tomatoes and spices in a market place for 13 years. She is currently facing a stock shortage which does not allow her to meet the demand of her customers. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of merchandise. This will allow her to earn enough income to repay her loan and to help her business to develop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Sonkoma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA III   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec  TENE  2ème debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché    après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SONKOMA III are all married women with an average age of 35, have 4 kids and live in polygamous families in Togodaba, a village of Fakola, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 
The group works with the mircofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to improve their farming business during the rainy season. 
They are on their fourth round of financing; all previous loans were properly reimbursed.
Tene, the 2nd woman standing on the left, cultivates peanuts.
With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizers and seeds, and to pay the labors costs to harvest 2 hectares of land.
She sells her peanuts at the village market after the harvest to both men and women customers.
She would like to make a profit of 145,500 cfa francs with each harvest.
The profits will allow her to pay back the loan and help her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor costs for the harvest.

loans.name: Aura Leonor

texts.es: La señora  Aura, junto a sus hijos, sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida y terminar de construir su humilde vivienda y seguir apoyando a sus hijos, desde hace varios años tiene su negocito el cual es  vender ropa nueva y de segunda, para ayudarse con los gastos en el hogar ella tiene que luchar solo para poder salir adelante. Agradece Afodenic  que atravez de fondos Kiva  podrá mejorar la infraestructura de la casa ya que el préstamo lo quiere para  comprar materiales como. Cemento, hierro, arena, bloque y asi tener un techo digno
texts.en:
Aura and her children dream about improving their living conditions and finishing the construction of their humble dwelling.  She wants to continue supporting her children and for several years has been running a business selling new and used clothing to earn income to help cover household expenses, since she has to struggle alone to get ahead.

She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for a loan which will improve the infrastructure of her home.  She will use the loan to buy materials such as cement, iron, sand and bricks so she can put a decent roof over their head.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Manuel Bernabe

texts.es: Manuel tiene 52 años de edad y es casado, él saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por  ejemplo hortalizas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is 52 years old and married. He is helping his family get ahead in life with a great deal of effort and dedication, as his main activity is agriculture and cattle-raising. He has several parcels of farmland where he grows various crops, such as vegetables.

He has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He belongs to the "Santa Ana" communal bank, and on this occasion needs the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. He is grateful and appreciates the loan. He promises to be very responsible in making his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Martina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Martina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

Martina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Judea

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Judea works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Judea is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items such as chips, egg, spices, soap, milk, coffee, etc. for her general store.

Judea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to buy some farmland.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like chips, egg, spices, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Mártir, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque los créditos son una fuente de financiamiento rentable en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar dos vaquillonas para crianza y concentrado para ellas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo mucho porque logro adquirir ganado de repasto, luego lo comercializo y esto le genero incremento en sus ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Mártir is requesting a new loan because he believes credit is a profitable way of financing his business.  The loan will allow him to buy two calves and concentrated animal feed.

The previous loan was very helpful to him because he was able to buy livestock which he later sold and generated more income.  Mártir's economic and family conditions have improved.

loans.use: To buy two calves and animal feed.

loans.name: Sonkoma Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   SONKOMA IV   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOGODABA, un des villages de FAKOLA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  MARIAM SIRIKI  1ère debout à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sonkoma IV group are married women who, on average, are 34 years old and have four children. They live in polygamous families in Togodaba, one of the villages in Fakola, in the third administrative region of Mali. The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Mariam Siriki, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of labor to cultivate two hectares. After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village at a market to men and women customers. 

Mariam Siriki hopes to earn 145,000 francs CFA per season. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Claressa May

texts.en:
Claressa May is 23 years old and has three children.

Claressa May works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, can goods, etc..
