Joseph lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya. This is a very fertile area for agriculture, located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school. Joseph has been farming for 32 years. His main sources of income are tea leaves, maize, potatoes and bananas. The major challenge he faces is that of insecurity. 

He has requested a loan of KES.20,000 for purchasing pigs for the expansion of his income base. This will improve the family's living standards and Joseph will be able to provide a better education for the child who is in school. In five years, he will have opened up a pork house to supply the whole market.

He says that the interest rates for Juhudi funds are controlled and affordable.

loans.use: To purchase pigs.

loans.name: Phelister

texts.en: Phelister lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is 37 years old, married, and a mother to one child. She operates a grocery store and dress-making shop. She intends to buy a piece of land and build her own premises where she can do her business. She has done this business for the last ten years and she strongly feels she doesn't need to pay rent. The challenges in the business is competition and financing. She learned of Milango through friends, and she has had previous loans with Milango, which she repaid without challenges. Her business has seen growth since she joined Milango. Extra income raised from the loan will help her to give her family better health care and education as well as better standards of living.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land and build her own premises.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg is 40 years old and lives with her 2 children in an apartment in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her daughter, Maral, and son, Manduul, both attend a local school. 

Ganchimeg has been growing organic vegetables on her plot of land and selling them in the local market since 1999. She has gained a lot of experience in the business and has maintained regular customers over the years. 

She is a hardworking, responsible and enthusiastic woman who now needs an additional investment of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rented stall. 

She covers her family's expenses from her business profits and dreams only of raising her children with a high and qualified education.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rented stall.

loans.name: Petre

texts.en:
Petre lives in Changamwe area, near Mombasa, Kenya. He is married to a teacher and together they are blessed with two school-going children. He owns a retail shop as well as a transport business. He has great ambition to have his transport business grow into a large public service company. 

Petre knows of Milango from friends. He has had previous loans from Milango which have been successful. He took out his first loan and paid it back without any challenges. He now seeks a loan to pay school fees for his children. He says that there have been challenges in business, and he mentions high fuel prices and inflation as the major setbacks in doing business. He wants to give his children the best gift that he can afford, and that is education.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has been blessed with two children. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For the past two years she has operated a food stall business selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: 07.01.10 Phú Sơn 1 Group

texts.en:
Đông is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. The other child is grown up.

She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 

In 2010, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đông is the group leader of the 07.01.10  Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Đông hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Amarjargal is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her mother, brother and 2 children in a Ger (Mongolian tent) in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her mother is retired and stays home, and requires constant care. Her brother works at a local mining company and her 2 children both attend a local school.

Amarjargal has been working in various types of businesses and started providing taxi service in 2012. She is now planning to build a small wooden house on her plot of land to open a grocery store and take care of her mother while she runs her business at home. 

She is now requesting 400,000 MNT to purchase medicines and other supplements for her mother. She is a hardworking, caring and open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and other supplements for her mother.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in Changamwe area, in Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a grocery shop as well as a transport business. He has been in this business for seven years now. He seeks a loan to buy vegetables and fruits for his grocery shop. He knows of Milango from friends. He has had a previous Kiva loan, and he was able to pay back without challenges. He wants to be a supplier and wholesaler in five years' time. The challenges that he faces in his business include high transportation costs and bad debts. This father of two will use extra income to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan is 35 years old. He is married and lives in his own house with his wife and daughters. He sells food products like milk, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 10 years. He started with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

He is now requesting 2,000 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar and vegetables for his   store. He has a good loan history. This is his 6th loan.

loans.use: to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar, and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Irene Guadalupe

texts.es:
Irene, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y su esposo tiene 30 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo el cual tiene 5 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la agricultura y pesca, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, fertilizantes, preparación de la tierra y para reparación de una red de pescar; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos, fortalecer más la agricultura, producir más y mejorar la pesca.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Irene is twenty-six years old and is married.  Her husband is thirty years old, and she takes pride in her son, who is five years old.  She makes a living in agriculture and fishing, trades that she learned from her parents and which she takes part in every day.

The loan that she requires will allow her to buy manure and fertilizer, and to prepare the land.  It will also allow her to repair a fishing net.  This investment will help her to grow her income, strengthen her farming in producing more crops, and improve her fishing.

Her dream is to offer her family a better quality of life and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to pay for manure and fertilizer, to prepare the land, and to repair a fishing net.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a highly vegetative area located along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has four children. He has practiced farming for 25 years. His sources of income are tea leaves, fruits, coffee, maize, and vegetables. His other source of income is motorbike transport.

He wants to venture into egg production and thus has requested a loan of KES 60,000 for purchasing poultry. This will add to his income base. This will improve their living standards and thus better their feeding habits. 

The challenge he faces is inflation. In five years he will have bought at least 2 acres of land.

He says that Juhudi caters to small holder farmers, hence uplifting them.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Goldyboe

texts.en: Goldyboe is a 22-year-old university student here in Oroquieta City. He used to help his parents to earn the living of the entire family. He exclaims that once he receives the loan and join GDMPC, he promises to work very hard and make himself and everybody proud, especially my mother. He will also help other students in the future and contribute to the growth of the community.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for the current semester.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 4 years she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a married mother of 4 children, 3 of whom attend school and one is still young. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan has operated a boda boda (motorcycle taxi business) for the past three years; his customers are town dwellers and passersby. The rainy season is his major challenge due to the hardships of transportation in wet weather. 

He decided to join Yehu to access its loans. With this 50,000 KES loan, he wants to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike to increase his efficiency. He dreams of expanding this business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man and has 2 children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in his business.
 
With the Kes. 60,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ulises Francisco

texts.es:
Ulises, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar herramientas y material de electricidad industrial tales como: focos, terminales, fusibles, entre otros. 
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que incrementaron los ingresos y las utilidades las invierte  en la educación de sus hijos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y está muy bien de salud junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ulises requires a new loan because he needs more working capital.  This loan will allow him to buy tools and industrial electrical materials like: light bulbs, terminals, fuses, and other items.

The effect of the previous loan was favorable, since his income increased.  He invested these profits in the education of his sons.  Their economic conditions have improved and he and his family are in good health.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, terminals, fuses, and other items.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 47 años de edad, está divorciada y vive en compañía de su hijo de 23 años de edad en una casa alquilada. Luzmila, se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene una taller en su hogar , en donde instaló varias máquinas de coser. Éste oficio lo aprendió en un centro educativo. Realiza ésta actividad hace más de 16 años, contando con la ayuda de una sobrina a quien paga por semana trabajada. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite desempeñarse en el oficio que le agrada y se siente a gusto elaborando nuevos diseños. Desea ampliar su negocio y en el futuro abrir una boutique en el mismo lugar. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles comprará materiales de confección como  telas, hilos, botones, entre otros.
texts.en:
Luzmila is forty-seven years old and is divorced.  She lives in the company of her 23-year-old son in a home that they rent.  Luzmila makes a living in making clothing for women, men, and children.  She has a workshop in her home, where she has installed a few sewing machines.  She learned this trade from an educational trade center.  She has been involved in this work for more than sixteen years and has the help of her niece, who she pays weekly for her work.

She likes this activity because it allows her to do something that pleases her; she feels at ease creating new designs.  

She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to open a boutique in this same place.  This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she feels thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to move ahead.  She also promises to pay her installments on time.  

With the requested amount of 1200 soles, she will buy dressmaking materials like fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking materials like fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has been blessed with four children. She rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a food cafe business, selling food consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the Kes. 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour for the preparation of food for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour for the preparation of food for resale.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kes. 30,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Arsena

texts.en:
Arsena is 48-year-old man from the Gurjaani district, East Georgia. He lives with his wife and 10 years old son, who goes to a local school. Arsena requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where peach trees are grown. Arsena looks after the trees and does all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested peaches are sold at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family as the income is only seasonally. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Arsena requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Arsena has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Arsena will purchase minibus. After the minibus is purchased he will begin trade with fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then resell at higher price. This will increase the income of his family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will give him a chance to have regular income and thus will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and begin trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya, 28 years old, lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been making and selling clothes in her workshop for a long time and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband has a position as decorator at a building company. She is requesting a loan of 600000 MNT to purchase silk, cotton and textiles so that she can continue to make and sell her clothes without worrying about a shortage of raw materials. Income from clothes sales is major source of income for the family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase silk, cotton and textiles

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 23 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos y de ellos 1 esta estudiando, ella se dedica a una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tienda pequeña y a la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería para su tienda tales como: huevos, aceite, granos básicos, papel higiénicos, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros, espera en el futuro tener una tienda más grande y bien surtida. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 23 year old woman who is married in a civil union. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She runs a business selling everyday products which she began with a small store. She has five years of experience and relies on the support of her husband who makes a living selling goods. 

The group organized to request a loan that will be used to buy merchandise for her store including eggs, oil, basic grains, toilet paper, refreshments, snacks and other goods. She hopes to have a larger and better stocked store in the future. The rest of the members of the group also make a living in sales.

loans.use: to buy everyday products.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of three children, all of whom go to school . They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Mwanamisi has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
This is Joy. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as in their personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joy dreams of having new products for her variety store to attract more customers. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir trabajando con su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diez quintales de maíz y más materia prima para realizar su actividad.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar los ingresos, ya que  le ha permitido apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y hacerle mejoras a la vivienda; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Ana has been presented with the need to opt for a new loan to continue working with her business. This will allow her to buy ten quintals of corn and more raw materials in order to work. Her previous loan helped her to increase her earnings, allowing her to support her children in school and make improvements to her home. Her economic conditions and family situation have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy ten quintals of corn and more raw material.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo prestamo porque requiere mas capital de trabajo; este  le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica tales como: frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceite, sal, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a que sus ventas mejoren  y obtendrá mayores beneficios con las ganancias.
Las condiciones economicas han mejorado, asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: María needs a new loan because she is in need of more working capital, which will enable her to buy everyday items such as broad beans, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and salt, among others. This investment will help her increase her sales and earn more with the profits. Financially speaking, she is faring a bit better now, and her family leads a better life.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Samson Waran

texts.en:
Samson is a Finance Sudan Limited client. This is his third loan from Finance Sudan Limited. 

He is a businessman who specializes in selling retail goods like shoe polish, shoe brushes, combs, dry cells and many others. He has been in the business for about two years now, and the business is growing steadily.

He is borrowing another loan so that he can expand his business more and more and serve his customers well.

loans.use: To buy items like shoe polish, shoe brushes, hair combs, dry cells.

loans.name: Nika

texts.en:
Nika is 20 years old. He lives in Gurjaani District, Kakheti Region with his mother and two brothers. Nika has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nika’s mother works as a sales lady and gets a small monthly income. The main source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where 85 peach trees are grown. Nika and his brothers do all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. As well as these activities, Nika works as an artisan and repairs damaged cars and motorbikes. He is a very hardworking young man and does his best to increase the income of his family. Nika requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nika has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Nika will purchase piglets. After purchasing the piglets he will be able to start an animal husbandry business. As the piglets grow, he will sell some of them at a higher price. Other pigs will be used to start a new generation and expand the business for the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loa, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: Con el crédito de Kiva que obtuvo el año pasado y dinero que tenía ahorrado María Inés pudo adquirir un pequeño terreno el cual tiene planeado sembrar con café orgánico para que de esta manera pueda aumentar su producción y sus ingresos. Para poder seguir adelante con su proyecto María Inés necesita nuevamente de un financiamiento por parte de Kiva para comprar planta de café y fertilizante orgánico. Llevando a cabo estas labores en tres años las nuevas plantas estarán dando sus primeros frutos.
texts.en: With the Kiva loan that María Inés requested last year and money that she has saved, she was able to buy a small plot of land where she plans to plant organic coffee. With these plans she will be able to increase her production capacity and her earnings. In order to move forward with her project, María Inés needs a new loan from Kiva to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer. Three years after she finishes this prep work, the new plants will be ready for their first harvest.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nurgis

texts.en:
Nurgis, 39, is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a milk seller and his income is inadequate to meet the household expenses. He is living with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Since 2001, he has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases milk from the dairy farm and sells it in the market. 

Currently, he is in need of purchasing more milk from the farm to continue his business. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. So his wife, Nurgis, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

Nurgis wants to provide a quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase milk to sell.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah is a 28-year-old single lady with one child. She currently lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

She was inspired by the love of serving the nation to be a teacher, which she has done for the last six years.

Like any other single, responsible mother, she has been able to use her low salary to educate her child and bought land to build a home. Her dream is to complete her house despite limited funds.

Madinah is requesting a loan to buy roofing materials like iron sheets.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials like iron sheets.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian has worked as a taxi driver for four years. 

He lives with his family and decided to start this business, thinking of his own progress and that of his family and his two children who go to school.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi. He appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of two. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells commodities such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. 

She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join with an aim of making savings. She learnt that she could access credit through Milango and that is why she seeks a loan to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. 

In five years time, she has ambitions of owning a wholesale shop. The challenge that she faces is lack of enough capital. The extra income that she will raise from the use of the loan will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Vicente renovó gran parte de su finca de café para poder aumentar su producción y esto fue posible gracias al crédito que obtuvo por parte de Kiva, pues anteriormente había trabajado con otros financiamientos pero le resultaba difícil estar pagando semanalmente cuotas debido a que en el campo no todo el año hay abundancia económica. Para la siguiente cosecha Vicente tiene planeado renovar otra parte de su finca así como adquirir fertilizantes para que la planta que sembró crezca fuerte y pueda dar buenos frutos. Para poder llevar a cabo sus planes Vicente nuevamente solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
During the last harvest, Vicente renewed a large part of his coffee farm to be able to increase his production. This was possible thanks to the loan that he obtained from Kiva, as he had worked with other lenders previously but it was difficult to be making weekly payments because there isn't financial abundance all year long in the countryside.

For the next harvest, Vicente has planned to renew another part of his farm as well as to acquire fertilizers so that the crop he plants will grow strong and be able to give good fruits. To be able to carry out his plans, Vicente is asking for another loan that he will pay after the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop

loans.name: Astrid Ivette

texts.es:
Astrid es una  joven estudiante Obstetricia en una Universidad local
Astrid tiene 18 años estudia la carrera de Obstetricia porque desde muy niña siente vocación por la misma, su carrera dura 4 años de los cuales está cursando un año y medio, su mayor deseo es culminar su carrera con éxito y lograr ser una gran profesional, en el futuro quiere ejercer su carrera trabajando en una institución de salud prestigiosa. Astrid es una joven muy estudiosa y dedicada, gracias a este préstamo podrá pagar las pensiones de la universidad y otra parte para comprar algunos instrumentos que necesita para el desarrollo de su carrera. Astrid está muy agradecida a los inversionistas por obtener este préstamo ya que sin este apoyo no habría podido continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Astrid is a young student of obstetrics in a local university. She is 18 years old and is studying for a career in obstetrics because she has felt it was her vocation from the time she was very young. Her degree program will last 4 years, of which she has completed a year and a half. Her greatest desire is to finish her degree successfully and to be a great professional. 

In the future she wants to pursue her career by working in a prestigious health institution. Astrid is a very studious and dedicated young woman. Thanks to this loan she will be able to pay her university fees and also buy some tools that she needs to develop her career. Astrid is very grateful to the investors for giving her this loan, as without this support she would not be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay fees and buy materials

loans.name: Gerrard

texts.en:
Gerrard lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has three children.

He has practiced farming for 28 years. His main source of income is tea leaves, maize, beans, and coffee. His extra source of income is a motor bike business.

He wants to venture into egg production and thus has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for the purchase of poultry. This loan he says will bring in more food and money for the family.

The challenge he faces is that of the dry spell.

In five years, he will have ventured in the taxi business.

Gerrard says that the services offered by Juhudi Kilimo are cheap.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 29-year-old married man who lives in Haja, Yemen. 

He is a teacher, who provides students with good teaching. He works nearly all day and is happy to continue this career. 

He started to build a small house by selling his wife's gold and his dad's land. He said that the salary that he earns is not enough to build his house. 

He has requested a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials for building his house. With this he hopes to have a more respectable home and to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building his house.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is 35 years old, married and a mother of five. All her five children attend school. 

For two years now she has been running a retail shop in her neighbourhood. She says that the major challenge that she faces is lack capital to fund the business. She also loves farming and she does that part time.

She knew Milango through a friend and she decided to join. This is her first loan on Kiva. She seeks a loan to buy maize flour, wheat flour, paraffin and other retail products.
 
Her longer time ambition is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, paraffin and other retail products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Florentino Tomás

texts.es: Con el crédito que obtuvo el año pasado por parte de Kiva Florentino Tomás pudo comprar abono, limpiar su terreno e invertir en su vivero de planta de café. Para la siguiente cosecha Florentino Tomás quiere ampliar su vivero y también necesita adquirir fertilizantes para su terreno. Tomás nos platicó que hace dos años resembró parte de su terreno y para esta cosecha estarán dando sus primeros frutos.
texts.en: With the loan that he received from Kiva last year, Florentino Tomás was able to buy fertilizer, to clean his land and to invest in his nursery of coffee plants. For the next harvest, Florentino Tomás wants to expand his nursery and also needs to acquire fertilizers for his land. Tomás told us that he replanted part of his land two years ago, and those plants will be giving their first fruits for this harvest.

loans.use: to expand his nursery and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Munege Group

texts.fr:
Serges fait partie du groupe  Munege et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 32 ans et est marié à  Emily, un cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de 1  à 8 ans, dont 1 étudie.
  
Il fait le commerce de boutique (haricot riz,…) depuis 12  ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot riz,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait améliorer son logement et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Serges is part of Munege Group and lives in Rumonge. He's 32 years old and married to Emily, a cultivator. Together, they have four children, aged 1 to 8. One of them goes to school.

Serges has been a retailer (beans, rice, …) for twelve years and he is seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

He will use it to bolster his working capital and buy a large quantity of the products he sells in his shop (beans, rice, …), in order to increase his income.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to improve the place where he lives and see his children study.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products to sell in his shop (beans, rice, …)

loans.name: José

texts.es: José produce café convencional y orgánico, sin embargo ya ha comenzado a realizar las labores necesarias para convertir toda su producción a café orgánico. Este proceso consiste en ir renovando sus fincas por etapas y el año pasado obtuvo un crédito por parte de Kiva con el cual pudo iniciar este proceso. Para este años José renovará otra parte de su cafetal y es por eso que nuevamente requiere un crédito por parte de Kiva para poder llevar a cabo estas actividades. Este nuevo crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en: José produces conventional and organic coffee. He has, however, begun to take the necessary steps to convert all of his production to organic coffee. This process consists of renewing his farms in stages. Last year he received a loan from Kiva with which he was able to start this process. This year José will renew another part of his coffee farm; because of this he requires another loan from Kiva to be able to carry out these activities. He will pay this new loan with his earnings at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Evelyn Fabiola

texts.es:
Evelyn es una mujer de 22 años de edad casada con 1 hija de 1 año y 3 meses,  actualmente viven en el Barrio Tzanjay San Andres Semetabaj, Sololá.
Es una mujer trabajadora que le gusta prosperar en la vida, cuenta con un pequeño local de compraventa de artículos como: ropa de vestir, ropa de bebe, cosméticos y calzado, se encuentra ubicado en el interior de su vivienda. 
Ella empezó esta actividad desde hace 3 años porque se dio cuenta que existe una fuerte demanda en este tipo de negocio. Por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00  para comprar ropa como: blusas, cortes típicos, suéteres, pantalones y playeras, para pode surtir su negocio y así  mejorar sus ganancias que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Entre sus sueños esta ampliar su negocio y darle una educación de calidad a su hija en un futuro.
texts.en:
Evelyn is twenty-two years old. She is married and has a daughter who is one year and three months old. They currently live in the Tzanjay San Andrés Semetabaj district of Sololá. 

Evelyn is a hard-working woman who wants to be successful in life. Inside her home she has a small shop that sells second-hand items such as: clothing, baby clothes, cosmetics, and footwear. She began this activity three years ago because she realized that there is a high demand for this type of business. 

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 Guatemalan Quetzals to buy clothing such as blouses, traditional clothes, sweaters, pants, and t-shirts to supply her business. This will increase her earnings and help cover her family's expenses. 

Her dreams include expanding her business and providing her daughter with a quality education in the future

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is 19 years old and lives with his family (his parents and a brother) in the small village of Kobuleti district. The source of income for the family is a small-scale agricultural business. In particular, Ruslan and his father cultivate a plot of land where citrus, nuts, and maize are grown. They sell the harvested products at the local open market. 
 
Several times, Ruslan has requested a loan from local financial institutions, but his loan requests were always rejected because of low income and lack of experience in the new business. His current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. 

Ruslan owns a car and plans to serve the locals as a taxi driver, but he will charge higher prices for his service because the benzene price is high. Not many citizens can afford to use the taxi service at a higher price. Because of the above mentioned problem, Ruslan has decided to change his taxi's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene, and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. This will allow Ruslan to decrease the price of the service, which will attract many customers. 

Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to pay for a fuel system change for his taxi.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is single and she lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are transportation and the rent for her house.

Margaret has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, Margaret wants to purchase two bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Yenniffer

texts.es:
Rosa es estudiante Universitaria de Administración de Empresas
Rosa es una joven de 26 años, eligió esta carrera porque su mayor sueño es tener su propia empresa, por ahora aparte de estudiar ayuda en el negocio de sus padres quienes son comerciantes. Rosa lleva estudiando 04 años y para culminar su carrera le falta solo 1 año, debido a su empeño le va muy bien en sus estudios, también  ha tenido la oportunidad de realizar prácticas en algunas entidades, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para empezar sus estudios del idioma ingles, algo muy importante para alternar su profesion. Rosa esta agradecida por este préstamo, porque gracias a los inversionistas de KIVA muchos jóvenes como ella pueden seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a university student in Business Administration. She is a young woman 26 years old who elected this career because her biggest dream is to have her own business. Presently, apart from studying, she helps out in her parents' commercial enterprise. 

Rosa has been studying for 4 years and she lacks just 1 year to complete her career training. Due to her efforts, Rosa is doing very well in her studies. Also, she has had the opportunity to gain experience in some enterprises.

The loan she is soliciting will allow her to begin studying the English language, which is very important for advancement in her profession.

Rosa is very grateful for this loan since thanks to Kiva investors, many young people like her can continue to study.

loans.use: to pay for her English course.

loans.name: Monna

texts.en:
Monna of Dulapo, Oroquieta City, is 21 and a proud member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). She helps her parents cultivate their farm to earn and living and to support her studies. But, this year, their harvest is not good enough to finance their basic needs.

Monna never stops striving hard in order to fight the crisis. She borrowed a  loan of PHP 5,000 in order to buy school supplies, so that she could continue her dream. She hopes to get a job after finishing her studies and be able to help her parents to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
For the past 11 years, Hellen has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, Hellen wants to purchase four bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the support being given.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: La cosecha pasada José Ángel renovó parte de su cultivo de café gracias a un crédito que obtuvo de Kiva. Con este crédito le fue posible comprar planta de café y fertilizante orgánico. Si todo sale conforme a lo planeado en un lapso de dos años él estará cosechando los primeros frutos de este trabajo que ha venido realizando. Para esta nueva cosecha José Ángel quiere continuar renovando otras partes de su cafetal así como fertilizar lo que ya tiene sembrado. Para poder hacer todo esto necesita nuevamente de un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha que es cuando cuenta con más recursos.
texts.en: A loan from Kiva helped José Ángel replant part of his coffee plantation during the most recent harvest. These funds allowed José Ángel to purchase coffee plants and organic fertilizer. If all goes according to his plan, in two years, José Ángel will be harvesting the first fruits of this labor. José Ángel wants to continue planting new trees in other parts of the plantation and fertilize the trees he's already planted. He needs another loan to reach these goals and will repay the loan at the end of the harvest, when his income is greatest.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo es un productor de café orgánico y durante la cosecha pasada resembro parte de su finca con la ayuda del crédito que obtuvo en Kiva. Actualmente su producción por cosecha es de 10 toneladas pero dentro de dos años esta podría aumentar a 15 toneladas debido a las plantas que sembró. Parte de las ganancias obtenidas en esta cosecha Pablo y su padre las invirtieron en una plantación de caña de azúcar, que es otra de las actividades a la que se dedican. Para la siguiente cosecha Pablo necesita un nuevo crédito para realizar labores de limpieza en sus parcelas y comprar abono, de esta manera logrará llegar a su meta de 15 toneladas.
texts.en:
Pablo is an organic coffee producer and he replanted part of his farm during the last harvest with the help of the loan he received from Kiva. Currently his production is 10 tons per harvest but within two years this should increase to 15 tons due to the coffee he planted. 

With part of the earnings obtained in this harvest, Pablo and his father will invest in planting sugar cane, which is another of the businesses from which they make a living. For the next harvest, Pablo needs a new loan to do cleaning work on his plots and to buy fertilizer. In this way he will be able to arrive at his goal of 15 tons.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clean his farm
